title: Who is the better writer, Shakespeare or Hemingway and why? - Quora
tags: Literature of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Shakespeare, of course. Hemingway isn’t even the best American novelist of his generation; Fitzgerald is. No novel of Hemingway’s has the canonical status of The Great Gatsby. Hemingway’s minimalist style was quite influential for some time, but I think it fair to say that its moment has passed, and, absent that distinctive style, there is little else. I am tempted to quote his contemporary Gertrude Stein’s comment on Oakland, and apply it to Hemingway: “There’s no there there.” Shakespeare, by contrast, is one of the indisputably great writers of world literature, the author of some of the finest and most enduring plays ever written. Unlike Hemingway, Shakespeare mastered a range of styles, from the extremely ornate to the astonishingly simple. One great line in Henry V, in Henry’s St. Crispin’s day speech, is textually simple, but rhetorically complex: This story shall the good man teach his son; And Crispin Crispian shall ne'er go by, From this day to the ending of the world, But we in it shall be remember'd; Only one two-syllable word, “ending”, but what a rhetorical expansion, from a single day to the very limits of time! There’s so much more to be said; but it would be superfluous. There really isn’t any comparison to be made.

Shakespeare has stood the test of time, perhaps even the test of rhyme. We hear more about his works and some of us appreciate not having to pass exams based on these, like we did when in School. I wasn’t fascinated by Shakespeare. I read a book that simplified some of the plays and found that helpful. I bought a beautifully-bound book of sonnets and wasn’t exactly overwhelmed by these. Even so, I was pleased that such a collection of sonnets was produced in such style. I’ve never been motivated to watch any play in a film or on TV. That’s just the way I am about my preferences, as I’d rather read modern poets than ancient rhymes and monologues. If others are fascinated by Shakespeare, then that’s their choice. As a poet, I’m more likely to create poetry than to read it as written by others. Even so, I found it useful to register on a poetry review website here: thewritersite.world I wonder how Shakespeare’s poems would have been reviewed if the Internet existed in his generation.
